unicode.value: CERTIFICATE IN EARLY CHILDHOOD DEVELOPMENT AND EDUCATION
CERTIFICATE IN EARLY CHILDHOOD DEVELOPMENT AND EDUCATION

Certificate in Early Childhood Development and Education
FOUNDATIONS AND MANAGEMENT OF ECDE, December 2010

Instructions to Candidates:

Answer ALL questions in section A and any FOUR questions from section B. Use clear and concise language.

Question 1

(a) Differentiate between a goal and an objective. (6 marks)

Sample Answer:

  • A goal is a broad, long-term aim that provides overall direction, while an objective is a specific, measurable, and time-bound target that helps achieve the goal.
  • Goals are general and abstract, whereas objectives are concrete and detailed.

(b) Define the term policy. (2 marks)

Sample Answer:

  • A policy is a set of guidelines or principles that guide decision-making and actions within an organization or institution.

(c) State two reasons that are considered important in having an Early Childhood Development and Education (ECDE) policy in Kenya. (2 marks)

Sample Answer:

  • To ensure uniformity and standardization in the delivery of ECDE services across the country.
  • To provide a framework for the allocation of resources and support for ECDE programs.

Question 2

(a) Give the meaning of Madrassa. (2 marks)

Sample Answer:

  • A Madrassa is an Islamic educational institution where children learn about the Quran, Islamic teachings, and Arabic language.

(b) Identify three functions of Madrassa in ECDE in Kenya. (3 marks)

Sample Answer:

  1. Providing religious education and moral guidance to young children.
  2. Teaching Arabic language and Quranic studies.
  3. Promoting cultural and religious identity among Muslim children.

(c) Outline five reasons that may make it necessary to establish mobile schools in Arid and Semi-Arid Lands (ASAL) in Kenya. (5 marks)

Sample Answer:

  1. To reach children in remote and inaccessible areas.
  2. To provide education to nomadic communities who move frequently.
  3. To address the lack of permanent infrastructure in ASAL regions.
  4. To ensure continuity of education during droughts and other emergencies.
  5. To promote equity in access to education for all children.

Question 3

(a) Define the following terms:

(i) Democracy; (2 marks)

Sample Answer:

  • Democracy is a system of government where power is vested in the people, who exercise it directly or through elected representatives.

(ii) Entertainment. (2 marks)

Sample Answer:

  • Entertainment refers to activities or performances that provide enjoyment, amusement, or relaxation to an audience.

(b) Outline four reasons for the importance of entertainment to young children. (4 marks)

Sample Answer:

  1. Entertainment helps in the cognitive and emotional development of children.
  2. It provides a break from routine activities, reducing stress and boredom.
  3. Entertainment can be educational, teaching children new skills and concepts.
  4. It fosters creativity and imagination in young children.

(c) Identify two ways in which pre-schoolers can exercise democracy in a classroom. (2 marks)

Sample Answer:

  • By participating in class discussions and decision-making processes.
  • By voting on simple classroom choices, such as selecting a storybook or game.

Question 4

(a) (i) Identify a suitable source of data that was used in a study on the challenges facing transition in an ECDE centre attached to a primary school in Kenya. (1 mark)

Sample Answer:

  • Interviews with teachers, parents, and children.

(ii) Outline six possible negative findings of the study in ECDE. (6 marks)

Sample Answer:

  1. Lack of adequate preparation for children transitioning to primary school.
  2. Insufficient communication between ECDE and primary school teachers.
  3. Inadequate resources and facilities to support the transition process.
  4. High dropout rates among children during the transition period.
  5. Lack of parental involvement in the transition process.
  6. Emotional and social challenges faced by children during the transition.

(b) Identify three advantages of a role model in mobilising the community in ECDE programmes. (3 marks)

Sample Answer:

  1. Role models inspire and motivate community members to support ECDE initiatives.
  2. They provide a positive example of the benefits of early childhood education.
  3. Role models can help bridge the gap between the community and ECDE programs, fostering trust and collaboration.

Question 5

(a) Identify seven services provided by the local government to promote ECDE programmes in Kenya. (7 marks)

Sample Answer:

  1. Providing funding and resources for ECDE centers.
  2. Training and capacity building for ECDE teachers.
  3. Developing and implementing ECDE policies and guidelines.
  4. Monitoring and evaluating ECDE programs to ensure quality.
  5. Constructing and maintaining ECDE infrastructure.
  6. Promoting community awareness and involvement in ECDE.
  7. Providing health and nutrition services to ECDE learners.

(b) Discuss four challenges facing service delivery by the local government in Kenya. (8 marks)

Sample Answer:

  1. Limited financial resources to support ECDE programs.
  2. Inadequate infrastructure and facilities for ECDE centers.
  3. Lack of trained and qualified ECDE teachers.
  4. Poor coordination and communication between local government and other stakeholders.

Question 6

(a) (i) Write EFA in full. (1 mark)

Sample Answer:

  • Education for All.

(ii) Outline six achievements of the Kenyan government in expanding ECDE towards realisation of EFA. (6 marks)

Sample Answer:

  1. Increased enrollment rates in ECDE programs.
  2. Improved access to ECDE services in rural and marginalized areas.
  3. Development of a national ECDE policy framework.
  4. Training and capacity building for ECDE teachers.
  5. Provision of learning materials and resources to ECDE centers.
  6. Enhanced community involvement in ECDE programs.

(b) Propose eight ways of overcoming challenges in provision of free and compulsory primary education in Kenya. (8 marks)

Sample Answer:

  1. Increasing government funding for primary education.
  2. Improving infrastructure and facilities in primary schools.
  3. Recruiting and training more qualified teachers.
  4. Providing free learning materials and uniforms to students.
  5. Promoting community awareness and involvement in education.
  6. Implementing policies to reduce dropout rates.
  7. Addressing gender disparities in access to education.
  8. Enhancing monitoring and evaluation of primary education programs.

Question 7

(a) Describe five elements of the communication process in community capacity building and mobilization in ECDE programmes. (10 marks)

Sample Answer:

  1. Sender: The person or organization initiating the communication, such as an ECDE teacher or program coordinator.
  2. Message: The information or content being communicated, such as the benefits of ECDE programs.
  3. Channel: The medium through which the message is transmitted, such as meetings, flyers, or social media.
  4. Receiver: The target audience, such as parents, community leaders, or local government officials.
  5. Feedback: The response from the receiver, which helps in assessing the effectiveness of the communication and making necessary adjustments.

(b) Outline five tips on public speaking a teacher would use to effectively communicate with parents in an ECDE centre. (5 marks)

Sample Answer:

  1. Prepare and organize the content in advance to ensure clarity and coherence.
  2. Use simple and clear language that is easily understood by all parents.
  3. Maintain eye contact and use positive body language to engage the audience.
  4. Speak with confidence and enthusiasm to convey the importance of the message.
  5. Encourage questions and feedback to foster interaction and understanding.

Question 8

(a) (i) State four types of information that should be included in a title of an ECDE research project. (4 marks)

Sample Answer:

  1. The main topic or subject of the research.
  2. The specific focus or area of study within the topic.
  3. The target population or group being studied.
  4. The geographical location or context of the research.

(ii) Give five reasons that would make it necessary for an ECDE trainee to report research findings. (5 marks)

Sample Answer:

  1. To share knowledge and insights gained from the research with the academic community.
  2. To contribute to the body of knowledge in the field of ECDE.
  3. To inform policy and practice in early childhood education.
  4. To fulfill academic requirements and demonstrate research competence.
  5. To provide evidence-based recommendations for improving ECDE programs.

(b) Give six reasons for reviewing literature in research in ECDE. (6 marks)

Sample Answer:

  1. To identify gaps in existing knowledge and research.
  2. To build a theoretical framework for the study.
  3. To understand the historical context and evolution of the topic.
  4. To avoid duplication of previous research efforts.
  5. To gain insights into methodologies and approaches used in similar studies.
  6. To support the validity and reliability of the research findings.

Question 9

(a) (i) Describe documentary analysis method of collecting data. (2 marks)

Sample Answer:

  • Documentary analysis involves the systematic review and interpretation of existing documents, such as reports, records, and publications, to gather relevant data for research.

(ii) Identify five advantages of using observation method in collecting data in ECDE research. (5 marks)

Sample Answer:

  1. It allows researchers to gather data in natural settings, providing authentic insights into children's behavior and interactions.
  2. Observation is a non-intrusive method that does not disrupt the normal activities of the children.
  3. It provides detailed and rich qualitative data that can capture the complexity of children's experiences.
  4. Observation can be used to validate or complement other data collection methods, such as interviews or surveys.
  5. It allows for real-time data collection, enabling researchers to observe changes and developments over time.

(b) Explain four leadership skills a teacher should possess to succeed in the development of ECDE programmes in the community. (8 marks)

Sample Answer:

  1. Communication Skills: Effective communication is essential for conveying the vision and goals of ECDE programs to stakeholders, including parents, community leaders, and government officials.
  2. Collaboration Skills: Building partnerships and working collaboratively with various stakeholders is crucial for the success of ECDE programs.
  3. Problem-Solving Skills: Teachers need to be able to identify challenges and develop practical solutions to address them, ensuring the smooth implementation of ECDE programs.
  4. Motivational Skills: Inspiring and motivating others, including colleagues, parents, and community members, is key to gaining support and commitment for ECDE initiatives.

© 2010 The Kenya National Examinations Council

Certificate in Early Childhood Development and Education
Foundations and Management of ECDE - December 2015

Instructions to Candidates:

Write your name and index number in the spaces provided above. Sign and write the date of the examination in the spaces provided above. This question paper consists of TWO sections; A and B. Answer ALL the questions in section A and any FOUR questions from section B. Answers to both section A and B must be written in the spaces provided in this booklet. Do NOT remove any pages from this booklet. Candidates should answer the questions in English.

Question 1

(a) Define the term 'Laissez-Faire' leadership style.

Sample Answer:

Laissez-Faire is a leadership style where leaders provide minimal guidance and allow team members to make decisions independently.

Question 2

(b) Give four negative effects of a military form of government.

Sample Answer:

  1. Suppression of freedoms and human rights.
  2. Potential for corruption and abuse of power.
  3. Lack of transparency and accountability.
  4. Restriction of political participation.

Question 3

(a) Outline four uses of a log book in an ECDE center.

Sample Answer:

  • Tracking daily activities and attendance.
  • Recording important communications and messages.
  • Documenting incidents and accidents.
  • Monitoring inventory and resource usage.

Question 4

(b) Identify six functions of the Teacher’s Service Commission (TSC) in ECDE in Kenya.

Sample Answer:

  1. Recruitment and placement of teachers.
  2. Professional development and training.
  3. Ensuring teacher accountability and discipline.
  4. Managing teacher salaries and benefits.
  5. Providing support for curriculum implementation.
  6. Facilitating teacher welfare and representation.

Question 5

(a) (i) Define the term objective.

Sample Answer:

An objective is a specific, measurable, and achievable goal to be attained within a certain time frame.

Question 6

(b) Explain four ways a teacher would use to promote moral values among pre-school children.

Sample Answer:

  • Modeling ethical behavior.
  • Encouraging empathy and kindness.
  • Teaching the consequences of actions.
  • Incorporating moral stories and lessons.

© 2015 The Kenya National Examinations Council

CERTIFICATE IN EARLY CHILDHOOD DEVELOPMENT AND EDUCATION
FOUNDATIONS AND MANAGEMENT OF ECDE, 2016

Instructions to Candidates:

Write your name and index number in the spaces provided above.

Sign and write the date of the examination in the spaces provided above.

This question paper consists of TWO sections; A and B.

Answer ALL the questions in section A and any FOUR questions from section B.

Answers to both section A and B must be written in the spaces provided in this booklet.

Do NOT remove any pages from this booklet.

Candidates should answer the questions in English.

Question 1

(a) Define the term data as used in Research. (2 marks)

Sample Answer:

Data refers to raw facts, figures, or information collected for analysis in research.

(b) Give four advantages of using frequency tables for data presentation in Research. (4 marks)

Sample Answer:

  1. Simplifies complex data.
  2. Facilitates easy comparison of data.
  3. Helps in identifying patterns and trends.
  4. Provides a clear and organized summary of data.

(c) Outline four benefits to a trainee who uses observation method when collecting data in an Early Childhood Development and Education (ECDE) centre. (4 marks)

Sample Answer:

  1. Provides firsthand information.
  2. Enhances understanding of children's behavior.
  3. Allows for real-time data collection.
  4. Helps in identifying non-verbal cues.

Question 2

(a) Distinguish between capacity building and community empowerment. (4 marks)

Sample Answer:

Capacity building focuses on enhancing the skills, knowledge, and abilities of individuals or groups, while community empowerment involves enabling communities to take control of their own development and decision-making processes.

(b) State four elements of a communication process between an ECDE teacher and the community. (4 marks)

Sample Answer:

  1. Sender (ECDE teacher).
  2. Message (information to be communicated).
  3. Medium (channel of communication).
  4. Receiver (community members).

Question 3

(a) Explain the term General Knowledge. (2 marks)

Sample Answer:

General Knowledge refers to a broad understanding of various subjects and topics that are not specialized or technical.

(b) Give five reasons that make integrity an important value for a pre-school teacher in the society. (5 marks)

Sample Answer:

  1. Builds trust with parents and the community.
  2. Sets a good example for children.
  3. Promotes ethical behavior.
  4. Enhances professional reputation.
  5. Encourages fairness and honesty in teaching.

(c) State three characteristics of a socialism type of Government. (3 marks)

Sample Answer:

  1. Collective ownership of resources.
  2. Equitable distribution of wealth.
  3. Government control of key industries.

Question 4

(a) Give four reasons for maintaining permanent store records in an ECDE centre. (4 marks)

Sample Answer:

  1. Ensures accountability of resources.
  2. Facilitates inventory management.
  3. Helps in budgeting and planning.
  4. Provides a reference for audits.

(b) Identify the type of information that a Sub-County Early Childhood Coordinator would find in each of the following records kept in an ECDE centre:

(i) log book; (3 marks)

Sample Answer:

A log book contains records of daily activities, incidents, and maintenance activities in the ECDE centre.

(ii) visitors book. (3 marks)

Sample Answer:

A visitors book contains records of visitors, including their names, purpose of visit, and time of visit.

Question 5

(a) Discuss four roles of a pre-school teacher in ensuring that children’s right to medical care is attained through immunization in Kenya. (8 marks)

Sample Answer:

  1. Educating parents about the importance of immunization.
  2. Collaborating with health professionals to organize immunization clinics.
  3. Maintaining records of children's immunization status.
  4. Advocating for government policies that support immunization programs.

(b) Outline eight qualities of pre-school teaching as a profession. (7 marks)

Sample Answer:

  1. Patience.
  2. Creativity.
  3. Communication skills.
  4. Empathy.
  5. Organizational skills.
  6. Adaptability.
  7. Passion for teaching.
  8. Knowledge of child development.

Question 6

(a) Identify seven ways in which the County Governments would effectively participate in community capacity building and mobilization of ECDE programmes in Kenya. (7 marks)

Sample Answer:

  1. Providing funding for ECDE programs.
  2. Training community members on ECDE practices.
  3. Establishing ECDE centers in underserved areas.
  4. Collaborating with NGOs and other stakeholders.
  5. Conducting awareness campaigns on the importance of ECDE.
  6. Monitoring and evaluating ECDE programs.
  7. Providing resources and materials for ECDE centers.

(b) Examine four disadvantages of using indirect mode of communication when mobilizing the community to support an ECDE project. (8 marks)

Sample Answer:

  1. Delayed feedback.
  2. Misinterpretation of the message.
  3. Limited interaction with the audience.
  4. Reduced personal connection with the community.

Question 7

(a) Highlight seven characteristics of a Democratic leader. (7 marks)

Sample Answer:

  1. Inclusive decision-making.
  2. Respect for others' opinions.
  3. Transparency.
  4. Accountability.
  5. Fairness.
  6. Encourages participation.
  7. Open to feedback.

(b) Outline eight factors that hinder the achievement of Education for All (EFA) in ECDE in Kenya. (8 marks)

Sample Answer:

  1. Poverty.
  2. Lack of infrastructure.
  3. Inadequate funding.
  4. Cultural barriers.
  5. Teacher shortages.
  6. Poor policy implementation.
  7. Geographical challenges.
  8. Low awareness of ECDE importance.

Question 8

(a) Identify seven services provided by the Higher Education Loans Board (HELB) in Kenya. (7 marks)

Sample Answer:

  1. Providing loans for higher education.
  2. Offering bursaries to needy students.
  3. Financial literacy programs.
  4. Career guidance and counseling.
  5. Scholarship programs.
  6. Loan recovery services.
  7. Research and development funding.

(b) Discuss four causes of Maji Maji uprising in Tanzania. (8 marks)

Sample Answer:

  1. Forced labor policies by the German colonial government.
  2. Heavy taxation.
  3. Land alienation.
  4. Cultural and religious oppression.

Question 9

(a) Identify five ethical considerations that an ECDE teacher trainee should ensure when making preparations for data collection for research. (5 marks)

Sample Answer:

  1. Informed consent from participants.
  2. Confidentiality of data.
  3. Avoiding harm to participants.
  4. Transparency in research methods.
  5. Respect for participants' rights.

(b) Explain five ways in which research data would be useful in ECDE. (10 marks)

Sample Answer:

  1. Informing policy decisions.
  2. Improving teaching methods.
  3. Enhancing curriculum development.
  4. Identifying areas for improvement.
  5. Providing evidence-based practices.

© 2016 The Kenya National Examinations Council

Certificate in Early Childhood Development and Education
Foundations and Management of ECDE - April 2019

Instructions to Candidates:

Write your name and index number in the spaces provided above. Sign and write the date of the examination in the spaces provided above. This question paper consists of TWO sections; A and B. Answer ALL the questions in section A and any FOUR questions from section B. Answers to both section A and B must be written in the spaces provided in this booklet. Do NOT remove any pages from this booklet. Candidates should answer the questions in English.

Question 1

(a) Define the term communication.

Sample Answer:

Communication is the process of exchanging information, ideas, and feelings between individuals through various methods.

Question 2

(a) Explain the concept of Democracy.

Sample Answer:

Democracy is a form of government where power is held by the people, either directly or through elected representatives.

Question 3

(a) Explain the concept of legal provision.

Sample Answer:

Legal provision refers to the laws and regulations established to protect and ensure the rights and welfare of individuals within a society.

Question 4

(a) Define the term analysis as applied in Research.

Sample Answer:

Analysis in research involves the systematic examination and interpretation of data to uncover patterns, relationships, and insights.

Question 5

(a) Outline seven tips of public speaking required by a pre-school teacher during community capacity building.

Sample Answer:

  1. Clarity in speech.
  2. Engage the audience.
  3. Use appropriate body language.
  4. Be confident and poised.
  5. Speak at an appropriate pace.
  6. Use visual aids effectively.
  7. Practice beforehand.

Question 6

(a) Outline seven functions of the Kenya Institute of Curriculum Development in early childhood development and education.

Sample Answer:

  1. Curriculum development.
  2. Training of educators.
  3. Resource provision.
  4. Research and innovation.
  5. Quality assurance.
  6. Policy formulation.
  7. Public engagement.

Question 7

(a) Identify seven ways a teacher would use teaching materials in management of a pre-school class.

Sample Answer:

  1. Enhancing learning experiences.
  2. Supporting diverse learning styles.
  3. Encouraging creativity.
  4. Facilitating group activities.
  5. Assessing student progress.
  6. Providing visual aids.
  7. Stimulating curiosity and exploration.

Question 8

(a) A researcher intends to carry out a study on factors affecting transition of learners in an ECDE centre.

Sample Answer:

  1. Identify the research design suitable for the study.
  2. Consider ethical guidelines in research.
  3. Ensure clarity and specificity in objectives.
  4. Define the scope and limitations of the study.
  5. Establish a clear timeline for the research process.

Question 9

(a) Table 1 below shows the attendance of teachers trained on Curriculum Development.

Level Male Female
Middle class 2 5
Pre-unit 4 12
Standard one - 13
Standard two 1 8
Standard three 2 19

Calculate:

(i) The percentage of male teachers trained.

(ii) The percentage of female teachers trained.

(iii) The mean for female teachers trained.

Sample Answer:

(i) Total male teachers: 9

Total teachers: 66

Percentage of male teachers: ≈ 13.64%

(ii) Total female teachers: 57

Percentage of female teachers: ≈ 86.36%

(iii) Mean for female teachers: 11.4

(b) (i) Define the term leadership.

(ii) Identify seven ways a community leader would use Democratic Leadership pattern to manage ECDE projects.

Sample Answer:

(i) Leadership is the process of guiding, influencing, and motivating a group of people towards achieving a common goal.

(ii) Seven ways:

  1. Encouraging participation from all members.
  2. Holding regular meetings for discussions and decision-making.
  3. Valuing and considering input from community members.
  4. Ensuring transparency in decision-making processes.
  5. Facilitating consensus-building among stakeholders.
  6. Empowering community members to take ownership of projects.
  7. Promoting equality and fairness in the distribution of resources and responsibilities.

© 2019 The Kenya National Examinations Council
CERTIFICATE IN EARLY CHILDHOOD DEVELOPMENT AND EDUCATION
CERTIFICATE IN EARLY CHILDHOOD DEVELOPMENT AND EDUCATION
